snippet: Eric Garner’s dying words as he was succumbing to a police officer’s chokehold reverberated in a wave of anger after a grand jury declined to indict the officer.
abstract: Demonstrators across New York City protest grand jury decision not to indict police officer Daniel Pantaleo in death of Eric Garner; block traffic, attempt to disrupt Rockefeller Center Christmas tree lighting and stage 'die-ins' at Grand Central Terminal and near Radio City Music Hall; chant some of Garner's last words: 'I can't breathe;' protests are mostly peaceful and few arrests are made.
lead_paragraph: Eric Garner’s dying words as he was succumbing to a police officer’s chokehold reverberated in a wave of anger after a grand jury declined to indict the officer.

headline.seo: In Chokehold Case, Protesters Revive a Staten Island Man's Dying Words
headline.main: ‘I Can’t Breathe’ Is Echoed in Voices of Fury and Despair
headline.print_headline: ‘I Can’t Breathe’ Is Re-echoed in Voices of Fury and Despair
